Class TextFileManager

java.lang.Object
  TextFileManager

public class TextFileManager
extends java.lang.Object

TextFileManager is a small utility class with static methods to load and save text files. It also provides String pre-processing methods for text analysis. See the Java tutorial http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/io/file.html

Version:
April 2014
Author:
Rachel Cardell-Oliver

cleanString

public static java.lang.String cleanString(java.lang.String line)
Pre-processing: clean a text string to characters, preserving case, and single white spaces

Parameters:
line - input string containing text, whitespace, punctuation and control characters
Returns:
String containing the alphabetic characters and single white spaces only

getAllTxtFileNames

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllTxtFileNames(java.lang.String dirname)
List the names of all text files in a given directory

Parameters:
String - dirname name of the directory to read
Returns:
ArrayList names of all the .txt files in dirname

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readFile(java.lang.String filename)
Read a text file into an arraylist of lines of text.

Parameters:
String - filename the text file to be read
Returns:
ArrayList of lines of text from the file

                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> text)
Write the lines of text in an array list to a given filename

Parameters:
filename - The filename to write to
